itemDescription: eldest child of Adolphus Cambridge, 1st Marquess of Cambridge, and Lady Margaret Grosvenor; nephew of Mary of Teck (1895-1981)

wikipedia_page.main: George Francis Hugh Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge,  (11 October 1895 – 16 April 1981), known as Prince George of Teck until 1917 and as Earl of Eltham from 1917 to 1927, was a relative of the British Royal Family, a great-great-grandson of King George III and nephew of Queen Mary, the consort of King George V. He was also nephew to the 1st Earl of Athlone. He was the elder son of the 1st Marquess of Cambridge, formerly the Duke of Teck, and his wife, the former Lady Margaret Grosvenor.

response: The last male-line descendant of the first Duke of Teck was George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge, the son of Adolphus, 2nd Duke of Teck. He died in 1981. The title and the marquessate of Cambridge are now extinct.
***Prince George of Teck, later George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge (1895–1981) m. Dorothy Hastings
* 16 April – George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge, member of the royal family (born 1895)

*The second branch descends from Duke Louis of Württemberg, and belonged to the Teck family. This branch became extinct at the death of George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge in 1981. It was not considered dynastic due to the morganatic marriage of Duke Alexander of Württemberg to Countess Claudine Rhédey von Kis-Rhéde. A cognatic descendant from this branch is Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom.

* 1981 George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge (1895–1981), son of the 1st Marquess of Cambridge. Interred in the Royal Burial Ground on 23 April 1981. His coffin is in the same grave as that of his wife.

link_mentions.page: List of alumni of Magdalen College, Oxford
response: * George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge, great-great-grandson of King George III
*George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge (1895–1981), great-great-grandson of King George III and nephew of Queen Mary
